p: On compression beyond ca. 30 GPa, a new set of reflections (Supplementary Fig. 2) manifest the presence of a new triclinic (space group P-1) phase, which we called coesite-IV (Supplementary Table 2). Upon further compression, the reflections of coesite-IV split and a new triclinic (space group P-1) phase, coesite-V emerged. Above ~50 GPa, only coesite-V was found (Fig. 1). Although upon compression the quality of coesite-V crystals deteriorates, the phase remains crystalline (Supplementary Fig. 2) at ambient temperature to at least 70 GPa (highest pressure achieved in this study).
